title: Trump announces sweeping global trade tariffs - including 44% on Sri Lanka
byline: United States President Donald Trump on Wednesday announced a sweeping set of reciprocal tariffs, imposing a baseline 10 per cent tax on all imports and significantly higher rates on dozens of countries with which the US runs trade deficits.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Southern, Eastern and Northern provinces today (03).

title: How Trump’s new US tariffs can impact Sri Lanka’s exports
byline: The higher trade tariffs imposed by the United States on Sri Lanka can put a significant number of jobs in the country’s apparel industry at risk in the near future, warns Professor Wasantha Athukorala from the Department of Economics and Statistics at the University of Peradeniya.

title: Financial markets tumble after Trump tariff announcement
byline: Global financial markets, including in Asia were rocked on Wednesday by Donald Trump’s announcement of sweeping tariffs, targeting China and the European Union in particular, with the risk of undermining the international economy.

title: India-Sri Lanka friendship to be reviewed during official visit: PM Modi
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi says that during his official visit to Sri Lanka the two countries will review the multifaceted India-Sri Lanka friendship.

title: Special train service in place for Sinhala and Tamil New Year
byline: The Department of Railways has planned to operate a special train service starting from April 11 for the convenience of passengers traveling to their hometowns for the upcoming Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

title: LG Polls: Notice for public officers assigned for election duties
byline: The Election Commission has received nearly 700,000 applications for postal voting in the upcoming Local Government (LG) Elections.

title: Health officials concerned by rising autism diagnoses among children
byline: Consultant Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist at Lady Ridgeway Hospital for Children (LRH), Dr. Swarna Wijethunga says that the number of children diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder is currently increasing daily.

title: ‘The Simpsons,’ ‘Family Guy’ renewed for four seasons at Fox
byline: Animated television sitcoms “The Simpsons,” “Family Guy,” and “Bob’s Burgers” have been renewed for four more seasons on Fox, Fox Entertainment said on Wednesday.

title: Britain imposes new travel permit requirement on Europeans
byline: European visitors to Britain will have to purchase an electronic permit in advance for trips from Wednesday, as the UK government follows other countries in seeking to strengthen immigration security by screening people before they cross its borders.

title: Three remanded in Rs. 27 million financial fraud case
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested one male and two female suspects in connection with a financial fraud case involving the Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Drugs Corporation.

title: Oil prices drop as Trump’s higher-than-expected tariffs spark global trade war
byline: Oil prices fell by as much as 3% today after U.S. President Donald Trump announced sweeping new tariffs that investors worry will spark a global trade war that will curtail economic growth and limit fuel demand.

title: TikTok bidders pile up as deadline looms with Amazon, OnlyFans founder in mix
byline: As the weekend deadline for TikTok to find a buyer approaches, bidders for the short-video social media site are piling up.

title: Magistrate suspended following probe by Judicial Service Commission
byline: A magistrate of the Marawila Magistrate’s Court has been suspended following a preliminary investigation conducted by the Judicial Service Commission.

title: President appoints expert panel to evaluate US tariff impact, propose solutions
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed a high-level committee to analyze the potential economic impact of the newly imposed reciprocal tariffs by US President Donald Trump and to provide recommendations to the government.

title: Call of Duty maker defends gaming’s impact on young men
byline: A developer behind titles in the Call of Duty (CoD) series has defended the effect of video games on young men.

title: Former Minister Mervyn Silva further remanded
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva, who was arrested for allegedly selling state-owned land to a private party by forging documents, has been further remanded.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon to be produced before court today
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who is currently in remand custody, is scheduled to be produced before the Matara Magistrate’s Court once again today (03).

title: TN Assembly passes resolution to reclaim Katchatheevu Island from Sri Lanka
byline: The Tamil Nadu Assembly on Wednesday passed a resolution urging the Indian government to retrieve Katchatheevu island from Sri Lanka. The resolution had unanimous support from all parties present.

title: Ex-chief minister SM Ranjith files appeal against prison sentence
byline: Former Chief Minister of the North Central Province, S.M. Ranjith, and his Private Secretary, Shanthi Chandrasena, who were each sentenced to 16 years of rigorous imprisonment on corruption charges, have filed an appeal against their conviction.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for severe lightning for several provinces and districts.

title: Two including woman arrested with foreign-made pistols
byline: Two suspects, a male and a female, have been arrested for the possession of two foreign-manufactured firearms and ammunition in the Boossa area within the Rathgama Police Division, police said.

title: Person sentenced to death over heroin possession
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced to death a person who was found guilty of being in the possession of over 16 grams of heroin and drug trafficking.

title: Myanmar earthquake toll crosses 3,000; heat and rains fuel disease risk
byline: Extreme heat and heavy rain in Myanmar could cause disease outbreaks among earthquake survivors camping in the open, global aid bodies warned on Thursday, complicating rescue efforts made difficult by a civil war, as the death toll surpassed 3,000.

title: PM Harini commends UNESCO’s initiative to protect Sacred City of Anuradhapura
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that UNESCO’s initiative to protect the historic Sacred City of Anuradhapura should be appreciated and emphasized that Anuradhapura is not only a Sri Lankan heritage but a universal value.

title: Sri Lanka’s Opposition Leader calls for Asia-centric trade strategy
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa says that the 44% US trade tariff on Sri Lanka is not just a trade issue, but a wake-up call to stop the silent defiance of regional interests of other nations and protect mutual interest.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam to be held on August 10
byline: The 2025 Grade Five Scholarship Examination is scheduled to be held on August 10, 2025.

title: CID seeks information from public over alleged misuse of President’s Fund
byline: The general public has been requested to inform the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) in writing regarding individuals who were aggrieved while attempting to obtain funds from the President’s Fund between the years 2008 and 2024.

title: Short-sighted politics steering Sri Lanka back towards bankruptcy - Dilith
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance Parliamentarian Dilith Jayaweera has issued a stern warning to the incumbent government on the backdrop of US President Donald Trump imposing a set of reciprocal tariffs on a several countries including on Sri Lanka.

title: 2025 LG Polls: Appeals Court to deliver decision on rejected nominations
byline: The Appeals Court is set to deliver its decision tomorrow (04 April) on three categories of rejection of nominations for 2025 Local Government (LG) Elections, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: ‘If we fail to negotiate on US tariffs, we have other options’: Minister on Sri Lanka’s stance
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Economic Development Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando says that Sri Lanka will hold talks and negotiate the new trade tariffs imposed by the United States on the country’s exports.

title: Suspended IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon further remanded
byline: The Matara Magistrate’s Court has ordered suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon to be further remanded until April 10 in connection with the 2023 shooting incident near a hotel in the Pelena area of Weligama.

title: US Dollar under pressure following Trump’s latest tariff
byline: Deutsche Bank warned on Thursday of the risk of a crisis of confidence in the U.S. dollar, saying major shifts in capital flow allocations could take over from currency fundamentals and currency moves become disorderly.

title: Colombo stock market slumps as ASPI drops by over 300 points
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) today faced a significant decline, with the key indices recording sharp drops.

title: Sri Lanka’s crackdown on street dogs for India PM’s visit sparks protest
byline: Sri Lankan animal rights activists marched on Thursday to protest the round-up of stray dogs a day ahead of a visit by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: One killed, one injured in Hikkaduwa shooting incident
byline: A 51-year-old man has been killed while a woman has been injured following a shooting incident at Karuwalakanda, Hikkaduwa.

title: Ceylon Chamber expresses deep concern over US tariffs
byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC) today expresses deep concern over the imposition of a 44% tariff on Sri Lankan exports to the United States.
